name: BBQ Chicken Strip Wraps with Slaw & Corn
description: Fast, kid‑friendly BBQ chicken wraps using the air fryer with crunchy slaw and sweet corn. Minimal prep and quick assembly for weeknights.
prep_steps: Set out 8 tortilla wraps on a board or plate.
Place slaw in a bowl and have barbecue sauce ready.
Rinse and drain corn; pat dry with a paper towel.
Have a microwave-safe plate ready for warming wraps.
cook_steps: Air-fry chicken strips in a single layer for 6–8 minutes until hot and crisp, shaking halfway.
Microwave tortilla wraps (stacked and covered with a damp paper towel) for 20–30 seconds to soften.
Assemble wraps: add a handful of slaw, a few chicken strips, and spoonfuls of corn to each wrap.
Drizzle barbecue sauce over the filling.
Roll and serve immediately; add extra sauce on the side if desired.

Assemble wraps: add a handful of slaw, a few chicken strips, and spoonfuls of corn to each wrap.
Drizzle barbecue sauce over the filling.
Roll and serve immediately; add extra sauce on the side if desired.

product_matches.package_notes: Needs ~600 g for 4 servings; two 400 g packs (800 g total) slightly overshoot but are closer and better value than the 18-pack specialty flavour.
product_matches.ingredient_line: Frozen Crispy Chicken Breast Strips 400 g

product_matches.package_notes: Recipe calls for 8 small wraps; only 6-pack available, so two packs provide 12 wraps to cover 8 with a few extra.
Target is 300 g; the Rainbow Slaw 300 g matches exactly and is the most economical fit.
Needs about 2 cups kernels (~300 g); the 500 g frozen roasted corn mix provides the right format and easy prep with some extra.
product_matches.ingredient_line: Frozen Roasted Mexican-Style Corn Mix 500 g

product_matches.package_notes: Requires ~120 ml; a 180 ml bottle covers the need with a little extra for serving.
product_matches.ingredient_line: Asian Korean Style BBQ Sauce 180 ml
